EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.96}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.17}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Farming Techniques on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Farming Techniques on the x-axis is {0.94}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Forestry on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Forestry on the x-axis is {0.94}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Crops on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Crops on the x-axis is {0.65}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Yield on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Yield on the y-axis is {0.52}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Soil Health and Labor or the cell corresponding to Farming Techniques and Yield?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Farming Techniques} and {Yield} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Fisheries and Technology Adoption or the cell corresponding to Livestock and Technology Adoption?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Fisheries} and {Technology Adoption} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.26 to 0.45?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Crops, Cost), (Dairy, Cost), (Crops, Demand), (Soil Health, Technology Adoption), (Poultry, Weather Impact), (Livestock, Yield)}.
